info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 21 at 10:30PM CDT until May 21 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LITTLE RIVER...SOUTHEASTERN HEMPSTEAD...MILLER... CENTRAL LAFAYETTE...WESTERN NEVADA...NORTHEASTERN CASS AND SOUTHEASTERN BOWIE COUNTIES... At 1030 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fulton to Queen City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 1022 PM, a 68 mph wind gust was measured at the Texarkana Regional Airport in Miller County. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Texarkana, Atlanta, Wake Village, Lewisville, Nash, Queen City, Fouke, Bradley, Garland, Ogden, Mandeville, Genoa, Brightstar, Canfield, Mount Pleasant, Bloomburg, Domino, Patmos, Gin City and Piney Grove. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
